momos.title: Momos
momos.Description: Enjoy the taste of Nepal with our Momos. These dumplings are filled with a delicious mixture of minced meat and spices, then steamed to perfection. Served with a homemade dipping sauce.

steps.step1: Prepare the filling by mixing ground meat, ginger, garlic, soy sauce, and green onions.
steps.step2: Roll out the dough and fill it with the meat mixture.
steps.step3: Steam the momos until cooked through.
steps.step4: Serve with a dipping sauce made from sesame oil, soy sauce, and cilantro.

dal_bhat.title: Dal Bhat
dal_bhat.Description: Dal Bhat is a traditional Nepali meal consisting of steamed rice (bhat) and lentil soup (dal). It's often accompanied by various side dishes.

steps.step2: Prepare a tempering with spices and ghee, then mix it with the cooked lentils.
steps.step3: Serve the dal and rice with various side dishes like vegetables, pickles, and meat if desired.

sel_roti.title: Sel Roti
sel_roti.Description: Sel Roti is a traditional Nepali rice-based doughnut. It's crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, often enjoyed with tea.

steps.step1: Prepare a batter by mixing rice flour, sugar, milk, and cardamom.
steps.step2: Heat oil in a pan and shape the batter into rings.

alu_tama.title: alutama
alu_tama.Description: Alu Tama is a popular Nepali dish made with bamboo shoots (tama) and potatoes (alu) in a flavorful curry.

steps.step1: Cook bamboo shoots and potatoes until tender.
steps.step2: Prepare a curry with spices and tomatoes.
steps.step3: Mix the cooked bamboo shoots and potatoes with the curry.

dhido.title: Dhido
dhido.Description: Dhido is a traditional Nepali dish made from buckwheat or millet flour. It has a dense, dough-like consistency and is typically eaten with pickles or vegetables.

steps.step1: Mix flour with water to form a thick dough.
steps.step2: Shape the dough into small portions.

gundruk.title: Gundruk
gundruk.Description: Gundruk is a fermented leafy green vegetable, often used in Nepali cuisine as a side dish or in soups.

steps.step1: Wash and cut the leafy greens.
steps.step2: Ferment them by adding salt and spices.
steps.step3: Use as a side dish or in soups.

yomari.title: Yomari
yomari.Description: Yomari is a sweet dumpling filled with a mixture of jaggery and sesame seeds, often made during the Yomari Punhi festival in Nepal.

steps.step1: Prepare a dough from rice flour.
steps.step2: Fill the dough with a mixture of jaggery and sesame seeds.

thukpa.title: Thukpa
thukpa.Description: Thukpa is a hearty Tibetan-Nepali noodle soup made with vegetables, meat, and spices.

steps.step2: Prepare a broth with vegetables and meat (if desired).
steps.step3: Pour the broth over the noodles.

newari_bara.title: Newari Bara
newari_bara.Description: Newari Bara is a traditional Newari lentil pancake, often served with spicy sauces.

steps.step1: Soak lentils, grind them into a batter, and add spices.
steps.step2: Heat oil and pour a ladle of batter to make pancakes.

chatamari.title: Chatamari
chatamari.Description: Chatamari is often referred to as the 'Nepali Pizza.' It's a thin rice crepe topped with various ingredients.

steps.step2: Top it with minced meat or vegetables and spices.
steps.step3: Cook until the crepe is crispy.
